page.title: 13GUILDFORD: ECOLOGY
page.content: Guildford's climate is typical of that found in S.E. England. Maximum rainfall occurs between October and December. The average annual temp. is approx. 10 degrees C. and can range from just below 0 to over 22 degrees C Relief is varied and undulating, presenting a scene of hills, heaths and richly wooded valleys. There are 3 principal groups of rock strata in the area. 1. Wealden Clay and Hastings Sands 2. Chalk and Greensand 3. London Clay covered in loams etc. Podsols which have developed on sandstones are covered with birch woods and heath. Beech woodland and grass predominate on chalk. The vegetation has been affected by man's activities ; hedgerows and coppices are common.{By J. Burgess, J. Paisley {S.Jerram and R.Chalklin
